en: I was full of shame at my rudeness.
I boldly painted my answer.
I looked at my bank account book, and happily discovered that I had an extra $50!
ko: 통장을 확인했는데, 50달러가 더 있어서 얼마나 기뻤는지 몰라!

en: I am content with my circumstances.
I am ashamed of my son's conduct.
I was ushered to my seat.
I've got to earn my own living.
ko: 내 밥벌이는 내가 직접 해야 해.

en: I am deeply attached to my hometown.
I remember the house where I grew up.
I loved my life and my money.
ko: 난 내 삶이랑 내 돈을 사랑했어.

en: I felt my heart beating wildly.
ko: 심장이 미친 듯이 뛰는 게 느껴졌어.

en: I am not so foolish as to quarrel with my bread and butter.
ko: 내 밥줄 끊길 짓을 할 정도로 바보는 아니야.

en: I'm not entirely satisfied with my position.
ko: 지금 내 위치에 완전히 만족하는 건 아니야.

en: I want to have a talk with him about my future.
ko: 그 사람하고 내 미래에 대해 얘기 좀 해보고 싶어.

en: I thought over my future.
ko: 내 미래에 대해 곰곰이 생각해 봤어.

en: I dreaded his reply to my letter.
ko: 내 편지에 그가 뭐라고 답장할지 너무 두려웠어.

en: I compared my car with his.
ko: 내 차랑 그 사람 차를 비교해 봤어.

en: I like going on trips in my car.
ko: 내 차로 여행 다니는 걸 좋아해.

en: I prefer to travel in my car.
ko: 난 내 차로 여행하는 게 더 좋아.

en: I like to have my dictionary within easy reach.
ko: 사전은 손 닿는 곳에 두는 걸 좋아해.

en: I had my bicycle fixed by my brother.
I took it for granted that my watch kept the correct time.
ko: 내 시계가 당연히 맞을 거라고 생각했어.

en: I have little, if any time that I can call my own.
ko: 나만을 위한 시간이라고 할 만한 게 거의 없어.

en: I am content with my job.
I lost interest in my work.
I am tired of my work.
I am very pleased with my job.
ko: 지금 하는 일이 아주 마음에 들어.

en: I can tell my umbrella from the others.
ko: 내 우산은 다른 거랑 구분할 수 있어.

en: I entrusted my property to the lawyer.
I'll try to shape my ideas into a book.
It is hard for me to put my thoughts into words.
ko: 내 생각을 말로 표현하기가 참 힘드네.

en: It's hard for me to put my thoughts into words.
ko: 내 생각을 말로 설명하는 게 참 어려워.

en: I acknowledge my mistake.
I admit my mistake.
I feel abashed at my mistake.
I gave my old clothes for the flea market sale.
ko: 벼룩시장에 내놓으려고 내 헌 옷들을 줬어.

en: I wrote to inform him of my decision.
ko: 내 결정을 알리려고 그 사람한테 편지를 썼어.

en: I accommodated my plan to those new circumstances.
ko: 바뀐 상황에 맞춰서 내 계획을 조정했어.

en: I cannot help laughing at my folly.
I'm not good at expressing my feelings.
ko: 난 감정 표현을 잘 못하는 편이야.

en: I had complete mastery over my feeling.
ko: 내 감정을 완전히 다스릴 수 있었어.

en: I want to make it clear that I have not changed my mind.
ko: 내 마음이 바뀌지 않았다는 걸 확실히 하고 싶어.

en: I came to regret my mistake.
I'm sorry about my mistake.
I can't convey my feelings in words.
ko: 내 마음을 말로 다 표현할 수가 없어.

en: I have already packed my things.
I've already packed my things.

ko: 고향의 음식과 문화를 정말 경험해보고 싶어.

en: I could not stand my house being torn down.
ko: 집이 헐리는 걸 보고 있을 수가 없었어.

en: I discovered too late that I left out the most important part of my speech.
ko: 연설에서 제일 중요한 부분을 빼먹었다는 걸 너무 늦게 알았어.

en: I'm not satisfied with my English ability.
ko: 내 영어 실력이 마음에 안 들어.

en: I have no great belief in my doctor.
ko: 우리 의사 선생님을 별로 안 믿어.

en: I made known my intentions to my parents.
I did it against my will.
I told a lie against my will.
I decided on telling her of my love.
I will have my own way.
I was wary of showing my intentions.
I'm interested in creating my own web pages.

en: I lay on my bed.
I was ashamed of my behavior.
I did so for the sake of my health.
I bought this book for myself, not for my wife.
ko: 이 책은 아내 주려고 산 게 아니라 내가 보려고 산 거야.

en: I'm very ashamed of myself about what I've done.
ko: 내가 한 일에 대해서 내 자신이 너무 부끄러워.

en: I'm sorry for what I have done.
ko: 내가 한 일에 대해서 미안하게 생각해.

en: I'm sorry for what I've done.
I have no regrets for what I have done.
ko: 내가 한 일에 대해 후회는 없어.

en: I can only speak for myself.
I wondered if I could do such a thing.
ko: 내가 그런 일을 할 수 있을지 의문이었어.

en: I hope to find a job of my own choosing.
ko: 내가 직접 선택한 직업을 갖고 싶어.

en: I myself was not conscious of it, but I may have been jealous of his success.
ko: 나 자신도 의식하지 못했지만, 그 사람의 성공을 질투했을지도 몰라.

en: I'm learning to sew so that I can make myself a dress.
ko: 옷을 직접 만들어 입으려고 바느질 배우고 있어.

en: I will do it myself.
I solved that problem by myself.
I have to go there myself.
I want to finish the work on my own.
ko: 그 일은 나 혼자서 끝내고 싶어.

en: I realized that what I had chosen didn't really interest me.
ko: 내가 선택한 게 정작 내 관심사가 아니라는 걸 깨달았어.

en: I believe I am in the right.
I am convinced that I am right.
I can prove that I am right.
ko: 내가 맞다는 걸 증명할 수 있어.

en: I hope I am very efficient.
I don't have to apologize for what I said.
ko: 내가 한 말에 대해 사과할 필요 없어.

en: I count myself lucky in having good health.
ko: 건강한 건 정말 큰 행운이라고 생각해.

en: I find it necessary to be able to say what I feel.
ko: 내 감정을 솔직하게 말하는 게 필요하다고 느껴.

en: I like to think I know what I'm talking about.
ko: 난 내가 무슨 말을 하는지 잘 알고 있다고 믿고 싶어.

en: I know what a lucky boy I am.
ko: 내가 얼마나 운 좋은 녀석인지 알아.

en: I am proud of being a doctor.
I'm sure of winning the championship.
I found myself bored by the book.
I have no regrets about what I did.
ko: 내가 한 일에 대해 후회는 없어.

en: I'm very proud of the job I chose myself.
ko: 내가 직접 선택한 직업이 정말 자랑스러워.

en: I know that I am a good teacher.
ko: 난 내가 좋은 선생님인 거 알아.

en: I know that I'm a good teacher.
ko: 난 내가 좋은 선생님이라는 걸 알아.

en: I know I'm a good teacher.

en: I held the party at my own expense.
I have a car.

ko: 며칠 내로 차 수리 맡겨야 해.

en: I had my bicycle stolen.

I got my bicycle repaired.
I have a bicycle.

en: I got on a bicycle and chased after the thief.

en: I found my bicycle gone.
I'm used to cooking for myself.
I want to have my own room.
I can't help loving my country.
I didn't say such a thing of my own will.

en: My ears sometimes ring.

ko: 귀 기울여 들어봤는데 아무 소리도 안 들렸어.

en: I was all ears.

ko: 책장을 한 장 한 장 넘겼어.

en: I'm getting off at the next stop.

en: I must get off at the next station.

en: I asked my teacher what I should do next.

en: I am having trouble with one thing after another.

en: I can run at the rate of fifty miles an hour.
I meet her at school now and then.

en: I read three kinds of newspapers in order to keep abreast with the times.
ko: 세상 돌아가는 걸 알려고 신문을 세 종류나 읽어.

en: I sometimes talk to my neighbor across the fence.
I sometimes cook dinner.
I visit my friend's house at intervals.
I sometimes visit my friends' homes.
I feel sad every now and then.
I sometimes play tennis with her.

I meet him from time to time.
I like to ride a horse now and then.
I go to the library from time to time.
I sometimes get uneasy about the future.
I fall asleep in the class every now and then.
I sometimes dream of home.
I'm sometimes in a bad temper.

en: I go to the movies once in a while.

I have occasional pains in the stomach.
I sometimes have pain in my stomach.
I sometimes enjoy my leisure in fishing.

en: I play tennis once in a while.

en: I looked up the arrival time in the timetable.

I bought a watch and I lost it the next day.
ko: 시계를 샀는데 다음 날 바로 잃어버렸어.

en: I checked the time on the clock.

en: I got over the difficulty with my characteristic tenacity.

en: I was given the task of cleaning the office.

I made the fact known to all my friends.
I know it for a fact.

en: I was called out to the scene of the accident.

en: I was late on account of an accident.

ko: 사고 때문에 두 시간 동안 묶여 있었어요.

en: I was late for school on account of an accident.

en: I keep a female cat.

en: I must prepare for the exam.

en: I cut the paper with a pair of scissors.

en: I want to improve myself.

ko: 저 말고 그 사람 이름을 기억하는 사람이 지금 있을지 모르겠네요.

en: I was annoyed with him for keeping me waiting.
ko: 걔가 나를 기다리게 해서 짜증 났어.

en: I asked the villagers many times to let me die.
ko: 마을 사람들한테 제발 죽여달라고 여러 번 빌었어.

en: I am loved by my parents.
I'm loved by my parents.
I see with my eyes.

ko: 난 우리 아빠만큼 힘이 세지 않았어.

en: I wasn't as strong as my father.

en: I smell with my nose.

I'm doing my homework.
I am doing my homework.

en: I viewed my action in the light of a crime.

en: I claimed my baggage.

en: I'm looking for my camera.
I've spent almost all my money.

en: I saved for future needs a little money as our marriage fund.

en: I didn't say anything at all about our plan.

en: I think it important that we should keep calm.
